Description: Large fragment of cherry red wool cloth, undecorated. Along one edge, (twisted) warp fringe and traces of sewing. Weft-faced simple tabby. Warp: wool, Z-spun, ca 19 threads/cm. Weft: wool, Z-spun, ca 36 threads/cm. Edges: warp fringe, otherwise partly cut, partly torn and partly fragmentary. Sewing: traces of sewing in undyed S-spun linen threads.
Curator's comments: History of use: sewing parallel to fringe suggests a long shape closed at this end. Compare cloth with that of the 'Persian Riding Coat' found at Antinoupolis; Musée Historique des Tissus, Lyon.
Condition: Good colour; one side is rotten.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
